thread.title: Ex On The Beach's Sean Pratt brands Maisie a SLAG as she reveals what she did in the villa
thread.title_full: Ex On The Beach's Sean Pratt brands Maisie a SLAG as she reveals what she did in the villa

author: Emmeline Saunders
title: Ex On The Beach's Sean Pratt brands Maisie a SLAG as she reveals what she did in the villa
text:
Ex On The Beach's Sean Pratt brands Maisie a SLAG as she reveals what she did in the villa The pair appeared alongside Zahida Allen and Harriette Harper for the Mirror's Facebook Live Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Ex on the Beach cast mates reveal what they think of Maisie Share this video Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Last night, Ex On The Beach returned for its sixth series, with even more sexploits, drunken drama and beefed-up blokes with more tattoos than brain cells. 
But what did the EOTB series 6 cast have to say about each other when they visited MirrorTV for a Facebook Live? 
Well. 
Sean Pratt, his now-girlfriend Zahida Allen , Maisie Gillespie and Harriette Harper joined us for a chat about the new series, and explained how they all clashed during their time filming in Greece. The Ex On The Beach cast dish the dirt to MirrorTV (Photo: Mirror Online) 
And it looked like the tensions which ran high in the villa are still causing runctions within the group, as we found out when we asked which word they associated with each other. 
Sean told us that Maisie – who had her eye on him in the first episode – was a "slag" – and she reacted by bursting into laughter. 
"Yeah, I'll take that, 100 percent take that," she said as the other girls gasped. Sean is put on the spot (Photo: Mirror Online) 
"You know what? That's who I am, and I'm going to roll with it." 
As Zahida and Harriette looked shocked, Sean explained why he'd used such an offensive term about his castmate. 
"You're not a slag – basically, Maisie was very forward in the villa towards the guys," he revealed. Maisie doesn't seem at all bothered by the insult, telling her castmates, "I'll take that" (Photo: Mirror Online) 
"I'm very open towards how I feel about sex and everything like that, and I think I shocked people with how forward I am," Maisie said. 
"You're not a slag but you're very forward, but we'll high-five it out," replied Sean, doing exactly that. 
It comes as the stars of the hit MTV show spill the beans on what went on in the villa. Sean looked embarrassed as his girlfriend Zahida covered her face in shock (Photo: Mirror Online)
